content.text:
# Draft:Battle of Nameless Hill

=Battle of Nameless Hill=
Duration: 16 November 1753 - 23 February 1754
Location: Nameless Hill, Gensokyo, Japan
Result: Hakugyokurou victory
Belligerents: Hakugyokurou Grenadiers,
Mount Youkai Tengu Guards
Background
The Battle of Nameless Hill was a significant military engagement during the First Gensokyoite War, fought in the region of Gensokyo, Japan. The battle occurred as part of the Offence of the Eientei River and is notable for its result, where the Mount Youkai Tengu Army were humiliated.
Prelude
The origins of the Battle of Nameless Hill can be traced back to the ongoing tensions between no one. Prior to the battle, both sides had been totally fine. But Yuyuko started it for fun.
The Battle
The battle began on the morning of 16 November 1753, when the Yuyuko attacked. The terrain at Nameless Hill played a significant role in the engagement, with a hill being in the middle.
The Hakugyokurou Grenadiers deployed a force of 200 soldiers, led by Youmu, while the Mount Youkai Tengu Guards commanded a force of 10,000, under the leadership of Momiji Inusubayashi. The confrontation quickly escalated when Youmu sliced 5000 Tengus in half
After that the Mount Youkai Tengu Guards aborted and went back to their base
Outcome
The battle ended with the Mount Youkai Tengu Guards surrendering after losing half of their soldiers to Youmu I the Great
Aftermath
Following the Battle of Nameless Hill, the Mount Youkai Tengu Guards experienced significant consequences. They lost half of their army
Casualties
The battle resulted in 5000 casualties for the Mount Youkai Tengu Guards, with the Grenadiers suffering only 1 loss
